feed.title: dbt Cloud Release Notes
feed.subtitle: dbt provides release notes for dbt Cloud so you can see recent and historical changes.
feed.rights: Copyright © 2023 dbt Labs™, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

entry.title: API requests have a maximum limit of `100`
entry.summary: Mar 2023: In order to ease pressure on our API, we have implemented a maximum limit of `100` for all API requests to our `list` endpoints. This limit is applicable to multi-tenant instances only.

entry.title: dbt Cloud requires dbt version 1.0 or later
entry.summary: Mar 2023: dbt Cloud now requires dbt version 1.0 or later and non-compliant jobs or environments were automatically upgraded to v1.4

entry.title: IDE updates and fixes
entry.summary: Feb 2023: We've enhanced the IDE by adding custom node colors in the DAG, ref autocomplete, double-click files to rename them, add link to repo from the branch name, enabled syntax highlighting for jinja, improve file tree render time, and more.

entry.title: Disable partial parsing in dbt Cloud job commands
entry.summary: You can now disable partial parsing in dbt Cloud job commands.

entry.title: IDE updates and fixes
entry.summary: Jan 2023: We've enhanced the IDE with improved syntax highlighting, faster and snappier IDE, improved error messaging, view repo status, added an easter egg, and more.

entry.title: Private packages must be cloned using access tokens provided by environment variables
entry.summary: Private GitHub packages must be cloned using access tokens provided by environment variables.

entry.title: Threads default value changed to 4
entry.summary: Threads now default to 4 users' profile.

entry.title: Creating a new job no longer triggers a run by default
entry.summary: You need to click **Run on schedule** before a job will be scheduled to run

entry.title: New IDE features and classic IDE deprecation
entry.summary: Nov 2022: We've enhanced the IDE by adding a button to automatically format your SQL. Added dark mode, Git diff view, and 4 new autocomplete options. We have deprecated the classic IDE.

entry.title: The dbt Cloud + Databricks experience is getting even better
entry.summary: The dbt-databricks adapter is now available for use with dbt Cloud

entry.title: Enhancement: New Cloud IDE launch
entry.summary: Oct 2022: Introducing a new dbt Cloud IDE that's faster, has performance upgrades, ergonomics improvements, and other delightful enhancements.

entry.title: Announcing dbt Cloud’s native integration with Azure DevOps
entry.summary: dbt Cloud native integration with Azure DevOps

entry.title: Query the previous three months of data using the metadata API
entry.summary: Metadata API data retention limits

entry.title: List Steps API endpoint deprecation warning
entry.summary: List Steps API deprecation

entry.title: Enhancement: Support for cross-database sources on Redshift RA3 instances
entry.summary: Adding support for cross-database queries for RA3

entry.title: Enhancement: New Cloud IDE beta
entry.summary: Aug 2022: Launch of the IDE beta, which focuses on performance and reliability improvements.

entry.title: Enhancement: Large DAG feature
entry.summary: Jul 2022: Use the Render Lineage button to visualize large DAGs

entry.title: Refresh expired access tokens in the IDE when using GitLab
entry.summary: Adding support for expiring OAuth access tokens.

entry.title: Credentials no longer accidentally wiped when editing an environment
entry.summary: Credentials are now saved when editing an environment.

entry.title: Audit log
entry.summary: Review actions performed by people in your organization.

entry.title: Email verification
entry.summary: dbt Cloud users created via SAML JIT will now confirm identity via email to activate their account.

entry.title: Scheduler performance improvements
entry.summary: scheduler, which has much faster prep times, especially at the top of the hour.

entry.title: Spotty internet issues no longer cause a session time out message
entry.summary: Mar 2022: We fixed an issue where a spotty internet connection could cause the “IDE session timed out” message to appear unexpectedly. People using a VPN were most likely to see this issue.

entry.title: Dividing queue time into waiting and prep time
entry.summary: dbt Cloud now shows waiting time and prep time for a run.

entry.title: Service tokens and bug fixes
entry.summary: Service tokens can now be assigned granular permissions to enforce least privilege access.

entry.title: DAG updates and performance improvements
entry.summary: Feb 2022: Clicking a node in the DAG opens a model or config file in new tab in the IDE.

entry.title: Autocomplete snippets for SQL and YAML files in IDE
entry.summary: Jan 2022: Autocomplete snippets for SQL and YAML files in IDE

entry.title: Model timing for Multi-tenant Team and Enterprise accounts
entry.summary: Model timing is now available for Multi-tenant Team and Enterprise accounts, plus performance improvements.

entry.title: Changelog 2021
entry.summary: 2021 Changelog for the dbt Cloud application

entry.title: Changelog 2019 and 2020
entry.summary: 2019 and 2020 Changelog for the dbt Cloud application
